channel.title: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki
channel.description:
i'm posting this here since you seem to never check your private messages.
http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=Special:RecentChanges&days=30
i've banned the accounts along with their addresses and deleted the spam pages from the wiki. it was sort of a pain in the ass because with out an extension deletions and banning must be done individually. could you add some sort of /better/ captcha or something and possibly block traffic from the abusing networks using iptables?
since this is a public post, does anyone else have any recommendations?

item.title: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

building off of the previous, you could some how integrate mitb/mscp accounts to the wiki and disable wiki registration.

edit:
28 March 2012

(Deletion log); 03:35 . . Admin (Talk | contribs | block) deleted "Benefits of Custom Writing Services" (Vandalism)
(Block log); 03:35 . . Admin (Talk | contribs | block) blocked Uclarindabbrethag (Talk | contribs) with an expiry time of infinite (account creation disabled) (Spamming links to external sites)

26 March 2012

(User creation log); 10:19 . . Uclarindabbrethag (Talk | contribs | block) New user account

again

Read full topic
item.source: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki

item.title: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Maybe adding some sort of “allowed users” script, and only usernames on the list are able to make/edit topics.

I know that would kill the point of the wiki, but it would stop spamming.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki

item.title: Moparisthebest: recent spamming of the wiki
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Do you think a different captcha would help? I didn’t see the posts, but recently things have been posted on here that were done by actual people, hence no automated system like captcha would stop them.

captcha and maybe some sort of blocklist of know spammers (see: peer guardian) might help

Read full topic

yeah some of them were a little funny
